file_content.text: Okay. We're set, but I've got to stick around a minute. Supposed to meet a contact.
What kind of contact?
A local. Won't take long, but get too close and you'll scare her off.
Firebrand? Everything's ready. I've got the Overwatch data, and the rest... the rest is done, too.
Good girl. Who says you can't get your hands dirty?
Listen, the others... they're out. They won't say anything, but they're getting their scars fixed. It's not fun anymore.
Yeah, well, they're morons. We've got each other.
I need to go.
Don't forget... you cause me problems, those scars can get deeper!
Idiots and cowards. Remember that girl in Kaas City whose dad you shot? She had spine compared to these people.
Idiots and cowards, every one of them. I've met Alderaanian nobles less pampered; more backbone, too.
Care to explain what that exchange was about?
Who was that?
You'd be surprised. I've seen Zakuulans fight as well as anyone. Knights, soldiers, allies and enemies.
Zakuulans aren't all cowards.
Maybe. But I'm not talking about Knights and soldiers.
The people of Zakuul have been sheltered from just about everything. Even their soldiers are naive.
We're in agreement there.
Haven't met many of the soldiers, but I believe it.
I've picked up a few fans over the years. That girl? Daughter of the Overwatch administrator.
Why is she helping you?
Same reason they all did. They're sheltered kids and rebellion is taboo. They don't really want Zakuul overthrown.
But almost getting blown up? Getting a few scars before the droids make them pretty again? Oh, that's a mark of pride.
The Skytroopers will find us soon. How many more junctions do you need to rig?
Let's keep moving.
Just one. Real soon, we get to watch the show.
That woman said the others were out. That they're getting their scars healed.
Yet they've abandoned you.
Apparently some Outlander turned up and soured my pals on rebellion. Hits too close to home now.
So you came to Zakuul without a support network and built one from your enemies? A Cipher agent couldn't do better.
I'm impressed you found them.
I was always good at using people. You just showed me a few tricks to get the most out of it.
At least our time together wasn't a waste.
I never said that. Come on--one more power conduit.
You're no more likely to bring down Zakuul than they are, and your defiance is just as petty.
You're all aimless rebels.
Don't judge me. I've got reasons for what I do.
One more power conduit. Then the show starts.
